Subjects: ballads; love, constancy in; love lyrics
_description: A balade protesting devotion and fidelity — three 6-line tail-rhyme stanzas

CULFf16.Transcription:
VerylyAnd truelyI Schall nat fayneWhyle that y leueI
                    haue you yeueMy hart sertayneThus y am setteNeuer to
                    Letteffor well nor wooYou to serueTyll that y starueWhere
                    euer ye gooContenew schall yAll way trewlyyn your
                    seruyceThere for to dyenat to faryeI you promyce
CULFf16.Facsimiles:
Beadle,  Richard,  and  Alfred E. B. Owen.  
             The Findern Manuscript: Cambridge University Library MS. F.1.6.
         London: Scolar Press, 1977.
